title: Elisa Roberts
text: Elisa Mary Roberts (born 3 September 1970) is a former Australian politician. Born in <a href="Sydney">Sydney</a>, she served with the <a href="Australian%20Defence%20Force">Australian Defence Force</a> at Victoria Barracks in <a href="Paddington%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Paddington</a> from 1989 to 1993, and received her Bachelor of Arts from the <a href="University%20of%20New%20South%20Wales">University of New South Wales</a> in 1996. Having moved to <a href="Queensland">Queensland</a>, she was elected to the <a href="Legislative%20Assembly%20of%20Queensland">Legislative Assembly of Queensland</a> in 2001 as the member for <a href="Electoral%20district%20of%20Gympie">Gympie</a>, representing <a href="Pauline%20Hanson">Pauline Hanson</a>'s <a href="One%20Nation%20%28Australia%29">One Nation</a>. She left the party on 18 April 2002 to sit as an <a href="Independent%20%28politician%29">independent</a>, leaving only two One Nation MPs in the Parliament. She was re-elected as an independent in 2004, but was defeated in 2006 by <a href="National%20Party%20of%20Australia%20%E2%80%93%20Queensland">National Party</a> candidate <a href="David%20Gibson%20%28Australian%20politician%29">David Gibson</a>. She re-contested Gympie in 2009 but was unsuccessful.
